segment.source: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules (Windows 10)
segment.target: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules (Windows 10)

segment.source: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules
segment.target: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules

segment.source: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules
segment.target: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: By default, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security allows all outbound network traffic unless it matches a rule that prohibits the traffic.
segment.target: By default, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security allows all outbound network traffic unless it matches a rule that prohibits the traffic.

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security includes many predefined outbound rules that can be used to block network traffic for common networking roles and functions.
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security includes many predefined outbound rules that can be used to block network traffic for common networking roles and functions.

segment.source: When you install a new server role on a computer or enable a network feature on a client computer, the installer can install, but typically does not enable, outbound block rules for that role.
segment.target: When you install a new server role on a computer or enable a network feature on a client computer, the installer can install, but typically does not enable, outbound block rules for that role.

segment.source: When deploying firewall rules to the computers on the network, you can take advantage of these predefined rules instead of creating new ones.
segment.target: When deploying firewall rules to the computers on the network, you can take advantage of these predefined rules instead of creating new ones.

segment.source: Doing this helps to ensure consistency and accuracy, because the rules have been thoroughly tested and are ready for use.
segment.target: Doing this helps to ensure consistency and accuracy, because the rules have been thoroughly tested and are ready for use.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: To deploy predefined firewall rules that block outbound network traffic for common network functions
segment.target: To deploy predefined firewall rules that block outbound network traffic for common network functions

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, click Outbound Rules.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, click Outbound Rules.

segment.source: Click Action, and then click New rule.
segment.target: Click Action, and then click New rule.

segment.source: On the Rule Type page of the New Inbound Rule Wizard, click Predefined, select the rule category from the list, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Rule Type page of the New Inbound Rule Wizard, click Predefined, select the rule category from the list, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Predefined Rules page, the list of rules defined in the group is displayed.
segment.target: On the Predefined Rules page, the list of rules defined in the group is displayed.

segment.source: They are all selected by default.
segment.target: They are all selected by default.

segment.source: For rules that you do not want to deploy, clear the check boxes next to the rules, and then click Next.
segment.target: For rules that you do not want to deploy, clear the check boxes next to the rules, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Action page, select Block the connection, and then click Finish.
segment.target: On the Action page, select Block the connection, and then click Finish.

segment.source: The selected rules are added to the GPO.
segment.target: The selected rules are added to the GPO.
